sen.j: 園田湖城（そのだ こじょう、男性、明治19年（1886年） - 昭和43年（1968年））は、近代日本の篆刻家である。
sen.e: Kojyo SONODA (male 1886-1968) is a Tenkoku artist (artist of seal engraving) in modern times of Japan.
Kojyo SONODA (male 1886 - 1968) was a Tenkoku artist (artist of seal engraving) in modern times of Japan.
sen.cmt: 故人なのでwasに変更しました。
sen.e: Kojyo SONODA (male 1886 - 1968) was a Tenkoku artist (artist of seal engraving) in modern times of Japan.

sen.j: 名は耕作、字は清卿、号 (称号)は湖城の他に平盦がある。
sen.e: His real first name is Kosaku, his Azana (courtesy name used by the scholars and the literati of Japan to lend an academic, cultured feel to the name) is Seikei, and his Go (second name or alias) is Heian as well as Kojyo.
sen.cmt: 清卿→Seikei （清卿） [定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした]平盦→Heian （平盦） ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: His real first name is Kosaku, his Azana (courtesy name used by the scholars and the literati of Japan to lend an academic, cultured feel to the name) is Seikei, and his Go (second name or alias) is Heian as well as Kojyo.

His real first name is Kosaku, his Azana (courtesy name used by the scholars and the literati of Japan to lend an academic, cultured feel to the name) is Seikei, and his Go (second name or alias) is Heian as well as Kojyo.
He was born in Shiga Prefecture.
He was born in Shiga Prefecture.
He was born in Shiga Prefecture.
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History

sen.j: 京都の藤井斉成会有鄰館の主事となる。
sen.e: He became a secretary of Fujii saisei-kai Yurinkan Museum.
He became a secretary of Fujii saisei-kai Yurinkan Museum.
He became a secretary of Fujii saisei-kai Yurinkan Museum.

sen.j: 書画の鑑定に精しく中国文物の収集を任されている。
sen.e: He was entrusted to collect Chinese products of culture because he was familiar with appraisal of calligraphic works and paintings.
He was entrusted to collect Chinese products of culture because he was familiar with appraisal of calligraphic works and paintings.
He was entrusted to collect Chinese products of culture because he was familiar with appraisal of calligraphic works and paintings.

sen.j: 富岡鉄斎・内藤湖南らと交流し、森琴石らと平安印会を興した。
sen.e: He interacted with Tessai TOMIOKA and Konan NAITO, and established Heianinkai with Kinseki Mori.
sen.cmt: 森琴石→Kinseki Mori （森琴石） ［国立国会図書館蔵書検索システムNDL-OPAC http://opac.ndl.go.jp/］平安印会→Heianinkai （平安印会） ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: He interacted with Tessai TOMIOKA and Konan NAITO, and established Heianinkai (Heian Seal Society) with Kinseki Mori.
He interacted with Tessai TOMIOKA and Konan NAITO, and established Heianinkai (Heian Seal Society) with Kinseki Mori.

sen.j: 門弟に水野恵 (篆刻)がいる。
sen.e: kei MIZUNO is one of disciples of him.
sen.cmt: 水野恵→Kei MIZUNO （水野恵） ［国立国会図書館蔵書検索システムNDL-OPAC http://opac.ndl.go.jp/］
